data.title: Czech films at TIFF
data.meta_description: The first cultural event bearing the logo of the Czech Presidency of the EU Council which took place in Norway was the screening of thirteen
data.text:
The first cultural event bearing the logo of the Czech Presidency of the EU Council which took place in Norway was the screening of thirteen Czech films at the Norway´s largest International Film Festival in Tromsø (TIFF www.tiff.no) between 13 and 18 January. The Embassy of the Czech Republic in Oslo and the Czech Film Center participated in this event and the Embassy arranged a coctail on Thursday 15 January in the Perspektivet Museum in the center of Tromsø.

The visitors could see five new Czech films (Citizen Havel, René, Night owls, The Karamazovs, A country teacher), eight pictures from the sixties (Daisies, The Cassandra cat, Intimate lighting, Loves of a blonde, Elective affinities & Moravian Hellas, Diamonds of the night, Who wants to kill Jessie?) and several episodes of two Czech cartoons. The film Daisies (Věra Chytilová) was screened on Thursday 15 January at 6 p.m. At the same time it was presented in another 6 cinemas all over the Norway (Europe´s Finest project, digitizing of old European movies).

The Czech movies had good visit rate, some of them were even sold out. The public and especially the children appreciated a lot the screening of the cartons „The Mole“ and „A je to“.
